article_title: Congress Left Lifetime Caps For Retiree Plans, Judge Says
article_text:
Congress Left Lifetime Caps For Retiree Plans, Judge Says

Law360, New York (May 14, 2015, 4:21 PM ET) -- Congress did not intend for the Affordable Care Act to remove lifetime benefit caps for retiree health care plans, a California federal judge ruled Wednesday in a case where a retiree’s wife racked up more than $1 million in medical bills.



While language in the ACA, the Employee Retirement Income Security Act and the Public Health Service Act may imply that lifetime coverage limits are gone, a closer reading shows that United Parcel Service of America Inc. and Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Illinois were...
